action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = silly
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<green> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<green> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "l" is correct and in the right position (green), while "a", "p", and "e" are not in the word (red). I will focus on words with "l" in the fourth position and exclude the other letters.
guess: loyal

attempts = 2
target_word = silly
guess = loyal
guess_feedback = l<yellow> o<red> y<yellow> a<red> l<yellow>

guess_feedback: l<yellow> o<red> y<yellow> a<red> l<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "l" appears in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow), and "y" is also present but not in the third position. I will now try a word that includes "l" and "y" in different positions, while excluding "o" and "a".
guess: lyric

attempts = 3
target_word = silly
guess = lyric
guess_feedback = l<yellow> y<yellow> r<red> i<yellow> c<red>

guess_feedback: l<yellow> y<yellow> r<red> i<yellow> c<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms that "l" and "y" are in the word but not in their current positions, and "i" is also present but not in the fourth position. I will now try a word that places "l", "y", and "i" in different spots, while excluding "r" and "c".
guess: flyby

attempts = 4
target_word = silly
guess = flyby
guess_feedback = f<red> l<yellow> y<red> b<red> y<green>

guess_feedback: f<red> l<yellow> y<red> b<red> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "y" is correct and in the right position (green), while "l" is in the word but not in the second position (yellow). I will now focus on words with "y" as the fifth letter and "l" in a different position, excluding "f" and "b".
guess: silky

attempts = 5
target_word = silly
guess = silky
guess_feedback = s<green> i<green> l<green> k<red> y<green>

guess_feedback: s<green> i<green> l<green> k<red> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms that "s", "i", "l", and "y" are correct and in their respective positions. The only incorrect letter is "k", so I will replace it with another consonant to complete the word.
guess: silky

attempts = 6
target_word = silly
guess = silky
guess_feedback = s<green> i<green> l<green> k<red> y<green>

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.

The feedback indicates that "l" is correct and in the right position (green), while "a", "p", and "e" are not in the word (red). I will focus on words with "l" in the fourth position and exclude the other letters.

The feedback shows that "l" appears in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow), and "y" is also present but not in the third position. I will now try a word that includes "l" and "y" in different positions, while excluding "o" and "a".

The feedback confirms that "l" and "y" are in the word but not in their current positions, and "i" is also present but not in the fourth position. I will now try a word that places "l", "y", and "i" in different spots, while excluding "r" and "c".

The feedback shows that "y" is correct and in the right position (green), while "l" is in the word but not in the second position (yellow). I will now focus on words with "y" as the fifth letter and "l" in a different position, excluding "f" and "b".
The feedback confirms that "s", "i", "l", and "y" are correct and in their respective positions. The only incorrect letter is "k", so I will replace it with another consonant to complete the word.
